comment: Very straight forward assignments, can be a little boring to sit through daily lectures, but goves lots of time to complete assignments. Easy going and relaxed. Easy grade.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Harper was a pretty good Professor. His lectures can be a little boring and slow at times and you don't really need to pay attention. You have plenty of time to complete assignments. He gives 100's on daily assignments and D2L assignments but can grade a little tougher on essays. Overall if you're looking for an easy A take him!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: I didn't necessarily enjoy all the texts we read, but he is very nice and wants you to do well in his class. He pushed back multiple assignments dates to make sure we would have enough time to complete everything on time. Many assignments progress from the other ones, where you do pieces of a major assignment in smaller pieces. (ENGL1102 honors)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Tough grader for the papers given. Reading assignments weekly, no clear due dates. Vague instructions/topics for the papers. Super monotone and boring, but super easy to pass if you actually take the quizzes and do the reading assignments. 3 absences allowed, quizzes, and one final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He cares soooo much about his students. Any freshman that are worried about adjusting from high school to college should be comfortable with his class. There are no in class assignments so he really just has a class twice a week to go over papers. Make sure you stay on top of online work and have peers revise your papers and youll be good!!!

GROUP PROJECTS. That was the hardest part. Four major written assignments, two in group. However, Harper is great - he cares, gives good feedback. Beware, practically perfect work  95. But he'll help you if you try, he's chill. Mini weekly assignments are 100% for completion, if you do the group work easy A. "Pop" quizzes extra credit if you show
Dr. Harper is honestly the most passionate professor that I know. He truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. You get the grade that you work towards, and he gives great feedback.

Great class. Makes you put in a little work but nothing unusual for college. There to help if you ask and is really understanding.  Come to class, it makes a difference on how much he's willing to help you and the grade you get. one LONG paper, a few random assignments. take home midterm and final. Dr. Harper was great, I highly recommend him.

Dr Harper is nice guy but sometimes his lectures and assignments can be confusing. I found this class to be challenging especially since I am not a strong writer. There are multiple assignments, a midtermfinal, and a 12 page paper.

I had Dr. Harper for Argumentative Writing, and I can safely say he's one of the best professors I've had at KSU. He offers great advice on written assignments and clearly cares about the class in general. His lectures are interesting, and no matter your skill level with writing, there's always something to learn here. Easy grades top it all off.

Dr. Harper has an excellent rapport with students and is super-supportive and enthusiastic about whatever students are interested in and want to write about. He explains concepts and assignments clearly but is also willing to alter the guidelines or syllabus as needed--and he makes class fun with relevant youtube videos and pop culture references.

Dr. Harper speaks on such an intuitive level that sometimes it is hard to understand what he is saying or what he wants. If you attend class, participate in discussion, and write relatively well, there's no reason you should make anything less than an A. Super nice guy.

Awesome English teacher, you will leave his class with a great foundation if you are an English major. I really enjoyed reading and writing about love this semester. The semester was based on Plato. I love his laid back teaching style. I highly recommend him.

I really like Mr. Harper. We had about 2 quizzes on a book about Plato near the beginning and 4 essays, the second one which was just a revision of the first. He leaves a lot of helpful comments on your graded papers and is very willing  to help you or give ideas on papers if you need them.
I really enjoyed this professor. He is very knowledgable and is very helpful if you have questions outside of class.

I took this online. It was a useless class. The final paper is dividing into many different parts and you are supposed to turn them in individually then the whole paper at the end. The paper is hard to write this way. It was useless. I learned very little of how to write argumentatively. The lecture notes and NPR recordings were not helpful either.
Good class, very demanding but if you finish your assignments on time you should be fine. Online class is the way to go for this class.

Very good teacher.  Will help you with writing and revisions.  However, class discussion and reading the requried material is not graded or important.  Just write your papers on time and you will be fine...
